department.ch: 人力資源管理研究所碩士班

goal.ch: In today’s workplace, organizations, managers, and employees are constantly required to work across national borders. Thus, the importance to understand the concept of cultural difference and to manage valuable human resources across diverse national boundaries grows significantly. This course examines human resource management (HRM) in the multinational context, with an emphasis on international assignees (e.g., expatriates). In other words, we will explore how organizations go about selecting, training, rewarding, evaluating their international assignees.
goal.en: In today’s workplace, organizations, managers, and employees are constantly required to work across national borders. Thus, the importance to understand the concept of cultural difference and to manage valuable human resources across diverse national boundaries grows significantly. This course examines human resource management (HRM) in the multinational context, with an emphasis on international assignees (e.g., expatriates). In other words, we will explore how organizations go about selecting, training, rewarding, evaluating their international assignees.

outline.ch: In this course, students will be required a great deal of thinking of the assigned readings before class. The seminar format will also allow students to advance own understanding of HRM in an international context by communicating arguments and ideas among others, listening to others, or even challenging others’ standpoints.
